content.text: Find the exact value of \(k\)
Find the gradient of the normal to the curve at the point \(A\), giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{5}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
The line \(y = kx - 5\), where \(k\) is a positive constant, is a tangent to the curve \(y = x^{2} + 4x\) at the point \(A\)
It is given that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx - 48\). When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 3\) the remainder is 6
Given that \(\mathrm{p}'(1) = 0\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Simplify \(\sqrt{x^{8}y^{10}} \div \sqrt[3]{x^{3}y^{- 6}}\), giving your answer in the form \(x^{a}y^{b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.
Show that \(4(t - 2)^{\frac{1}{2}} + 5(t - 2)^{\frac{3}{2}}\) can be written in the form \((t - 2)^{p}(qt + r)\), where \(p\), \(q\) and \(r\) are constants to be found
Hence solve the equation \(4(t - 2)^{\frac{1}{2}} + 5(t - 2)^{\frac{3}{2}} = 0\)
State the range of f
Find \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) and state its domain
It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 3\mathrm{e}^{- 4x} + 5\) for \(x\in \mathbb{R}\)
It is given that \(\mathrm{g}(x) = x^{2} + 5\) and \(\mathrm{h}(x) = \ln x\) for \(x > 0\). Solve \(\mathrm{hg}(x) = 2\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\), the vector \(\overrightarrow{OM}\)
Given that \(OM:MB = 2:3\), find \(\mathbf{b}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\)

The diagram shows a figure \(OABC\), where \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}\). The lines \(AC\) and \(OB\) intersect at the point \(M\) where \(M\) is the midpoint of the line \(AC\)
Find \(\mathbf{p}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{i}\) and \(\mathbf{j}\)
Find the vector \(\mathbf{q}\) such that \(2\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}\) is parallel to the positive \(y\)-axis and has a magnitude of 12 units
Hence show that \(|\mathbf{q}| = k\sqrt{5}\) , where \(k\) is an integer to be found
Vectors \(\mathbf{i}\) and \(\mathbf{j}\) are unit vectors parallel to the \(x\)-axis and \(y\)-axis respectively
The vector \(\mathbf{p}\) has a magnitude of 39 units and has the same direction as \(- 10\mathbf{i} + 24\mathbf{j}\)
Show that angle \(AOB\) is 2.08 radians, correct to 2 decimal places
Find the area of the shaded region \(ADC B\)
Find the perimeter of the shaded region \(ADC B\)

The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\). The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the circumference of the circle and form a rectangle with the points \(C\) and \(D\). The length of \(AD\) is \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and the area of the minor sector \(AOB\) is \(150\mathrm{cm}^2\)
Show that the curve \(y = (3x^{2} + 8)^{\frac{5}{3}}\) has only one stationary point. Find the coordinates of this stationary point and determine its nature
On the axes below sketch the graphs of \(y = |2x - 5|\) and \(9y = 80x - 16x^2\)
Hence show that the graphs of \(y = |2x - 5|\) and \(9y = 80x - 16x^2\) intersect at the points where \(y = 4\)
Hence find the values of \(x\) for which \(9|2x - 5| \leqslant 80x - 16x^2\)
Show that \(5 + 4\tan^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right) = 4\sec^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right) + 1.\)
Given that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}\Big(\tan \Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\Big) = \frac{1}{3}\sec^2\Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\), find \(\int \sec^2\Big(\frac{x}{3}\Big)\mathrm{d}x.\)

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = 5 + 4\tan^{2}\left(\frac{x}{3}\right)\). Using the results from parts **(i)** and **(ii)**, find the exact area of the shaded region enclosed by the curve, the \(x\)-axis and the lines \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\) and \(x = \pi\)
Given that \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{3x}}{4x^2 + 1}\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\)
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dx}}{\mathrm{dt}}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\)
Variables \(x, y\) and \(t\) are such that \(y = 4 \cos \left(x + \frac{\pi}{3}\right) + 2 \sqrt{3} \sin \left(x + \frac{\pi}{3}\right)\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dt}} = 10\)
